MCQ: Who coined the term 'machine learning' in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Walter Pitts | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cyberdyne | b: Cybertron | c: Cybernet | d: Cyberware

MCQ: Who provided a widely quoted definition of machine learning algorithms in the field?
Choices: a: Tom M. Mitchell | b: Alan Turing | c: Donald Hebb | d: Arthur Samuel

MCQ: What is one of the objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To develop complex computer games | b: To make predictions for future outcomes | c: To study human cognitive processes | d: To analyze historical data

MCQ: Which mathematical models were proposed by Walter Pitts and Warren McCulloch for early neural networks?
Choices: a: Linear regression models | b: Decision tree models | c: Bayesian models | d: Neural network models
